data.title: Girls — The Cover Girls
data.text:
KRISTA THOMSON

Originally from New Zealand, Krista started singing on stage at the age of 5. By 8 years old she was a regular on the competitive country music scene. She has won numerous awards around Australasia including the Golden Guitars in New Zealand and The Aristocrat Entertainer of the Year in Tamworth, Australia. Krista went on to study at The National Academy of Singing and Dramatic Art where she gained her Bachelor’s Degree in Music Theatre. Since graduating her theatre credits have included: Oliver!, Beauty and the Beast, Cats, The Frog Prince, A Midsummer Night’s Dream and Melbourne's production of Doubt: A Parable where she played the role of Sister James.

Krista has had over 2 decades of experience performing at events and weddings and as one of the creators of ‘The Cover Girls’ is proud to be part of this top quality and highly entertaining group.

MICHELLE HUNT

Michelle is thrilled to joining The Cover Girls to share her passion of song, dance and performance. She has been performing for the past 17 years, and has taught singing and dancing the past 10. Michelle was born and raised in America where she had the privilege to perform at the 2002 Winter Olympics, for Formula 1 Racing, a variety of conventions, and Entertainment Theme Parks. After gaining her Dance Education degree in 2007, she left America to perform on Holland America Cruise Lines with Stilletto Entertainment where she sang and danced with Dancing with the Stars at Sea.

Since moving to Australia, Michelle has had performing opportunities at Crown, with Krazy Bar Entertainment, CLOC Musical Theatre, and Voltaire Entertainment. She is excited to bring her flare and spark to the CG Team.

SHARON STOKES

Sharon has been professionally singing and performing in shows around the world for over 10 years. Sharon has a BA in Drama and Musical Theatre and completed a Cert II of Musical Theatre at the Western Australian Academy of Performing Arts.

Sharon has performed for Universal Studios in Japan, performed as the production vocalist for Princess Cruises & Seabourn Cruises, travelled Europe for Thomson Gold singing in a band in 5 star resorts in Rhodes, Greece and Majorca. She has also performed all over Australia in various cabarets and musicals such as South Pacific and the Magnormos production of Children Of Eden.

Since moving to Melbourne, Sharon has started her own successful company, Entertainment 88, specialising in singing lessons, corporate entertainment, videography and the highly popular, Pop Choir.

ALEXIA BRINSLEY

Alexia grew up in Queenstown, New Zealand making the move to Melbourne to study Musical Theatre full time at APO Arts Academy and Danceworld Studios. Since graduating Alexia's theatre credits include Prick the musical, Once Upon a Pantomime, High Fidelity, 16 years old - An Original Cabaret at The Loft Theatre 2015. Also the Cabaret Showcases, Out of the Blue - A new Australian Musical, Saturday Night Fever at Chapel off Chapel and played a principle role in a New Australian professional workshop of Cinderella.

Alexia is a Vic Theatre guild award nominated Choreographer for her work on 'CGTC's Spelling Bee. Alexia has featured on both New Zealand and Australian television in various commercials, guest hosting NZ's popular TV show What Now? And Australian Sketch comedy Series What's Wrong With You?. She also played the cameo role of Sandy in ABC’s AFI nominated series It's a Date, written and directed by Peter Helier.

Alexia is very excited to be entertaining audiences singing some of her favourite songs with her favourite girl group! ‘The Cover Girls!’
